item.title: Arrays
item.description: The focus here is less on code semantics and more on ideas. Wait … why are we talking about variables, here? Arrays expand the concept of a single variable. An array, in some sense, is a collection of individual variables. For example, assume we have 7 books. If we want to contain each book, we have to declare an individual variable for each one of those 7 books. But what if we have more than 7 books?

item.title: Getting Perspective
100DaysOfCode
item.description: Not too long ago I started the #100DaysOfCode challenge. It’s a challenge that invites people to code for one hour minimum every single day working on projects, whether that’s one big project, or several small projects. The challenge mostly provides developers motivation, community support, and accountability. I’m not a developer. I don’t ever plan to be. But I like coding. I like reading code. I like debugging and analyzing code. I like understanding code better.
